intro: Secamone neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia secamone, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or montane forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
